title: 111_s4055
content:
The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 is also known as the Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act. It includes provisions for the extension of Trade Adjustment Assistance and health coverage improvement. Subtitle C of the Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 includes provisions for improving the affordability of credit, payment for monthly premiums, eligibility for credit for TAA recipients not in training programs, rules for determining creditable coverage lapse, qualification of family members, COBRA benefits extension, coverage through voluntary employees' beneficiary associations, and notice requirements. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 includes provisions for improving credit affordability, premium payments, eligibility rules, coverage lapse determination, family member qualification, COBRA benefits extension, and notice requirements. Additionally, the Act establishes the Community College and Career Training Grant Program and outlines offsets related to customs user fees, corporate estimated tax payments, and compliance with PAYGO. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 includes amendments to the Trade and Globalization Adjustment Assistance Act of 2009, changing dates and application of prior laws related to trade assistance programs. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 amends the Trade and Globalization Adjustment Assistance Act of 2009 by changing dates and application of prior laws related to trade assistance programs. Key changes include substituting specific dates in various sections of the Act. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 amends the Trade and Globalization Adjustment Assistance Act of 2009 by changing dates and application of prior laws related to trade assistance programs. Specifically, the Act adjusts dates for assistance provision under chapter 3, extending the deadline to June 30, 2013, and allowing exceptions for assistance approved before this date if funds are available. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 amends the Trade and Globalization Adjustment Assistance Act of 2009 by changing dates and application of prior laws related to trade assistance programs. Assistance under chapter 6 may not be provided after June 30, 2013, except for approved assistance if funds are available and the recipient is eligible. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 makes amendments to the Trade Act of 1974, changing dates and amounts for trade assistance programs. Total payments are capped at $575,000,000 for fiscal year 2011 and $431,250,000 for the 9-month period from October 1, 2011, to June 30, 2012. Various sections of the Trade Act are amended to reflect these changes. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 amends the Trade Act of 1974 by changing dates and amounts for trade assistance programs. Total payments are capped at $575,000,000 for fiscal year 2011 and $431,250,000 for the 9-month period from October 1, 2011, to June 30, 2012. Various sections of the Trade Act are amended accordingly. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 modifies the Trade Act of 1974 by adjusting funding amounts and timelines for trade assistance programs. The Secretary is authorized to provide grants to eligible communities totaling $25,000,000 for fiscal year 2011 and $18,750,000 for the 9-month period from October 1, 2011, to June 30, 2012. Amendments are made to section 277(c) of the Trade Act to reflect these changes. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 modifies the Trade Act of 1974 by adjusting funding amounts and timelines for trade assistance programs. Section 279B(a) is amended to authorize $40,000,000 for fiscal year 2011 and $30,000,000 for the 9-month period from October 1, 2011, to June 30, 2012. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 adjusts funding amounts and timelines for trade assistance programs under the Trade Act of 1974. Section 285 is amended to extend the deadline to June 30, 2012, and Section 298(a) is amended to allocate $67,500,000 for the 9-month period from January 1, 2011, to September 30, 2011. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 adjusts funding amounts and timelines for trade assistance programs under the Trade Act of 1974. Section 285 is amended to extend the deadline to June 30, 2012, and Section 298(a) is amended to allocate $67,500,000 for the 9-month period from January 1, 2011, to September 30, 2011. The table of contents for the Trade Act of 1974 is amended by striking the item relating to section 235 and inserting a new section. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 adjusts funding amounts and timelines for trade assistance programs. It extends the deadline for implementing merit-based State personnel staffing requirements to June 30, 2012. Effective dates for the amendments are specified in the sections. The Trade Adjustment Assistance Extension Act of 2010 extends the deadline for implementing staffing requirements to June 30, 2012. Section 111 amends the Internal Revenue Code to improve credit affordability, effective July 1, 2012. Section 112 adjusts payment for monthly premiums, effective after December 31, 2010. Section 113 allows TAA recipients not enrolled in training programs to be eligible for credit. SEC. 113. TAA recipients not in training programs eligible for credit effective July 1, 2012. SEC. 114. TAA pre-certification period rule for determining creditable coverage lapse. SEC. 115 amends various sections of the Internal Revenue Code, Employee Retirement Income Security Act, and Public Health Service Act by changing the effective date from January 1, 2011, to July 1, 2012. The amendments apply to plan years starting after December 31, 2010. SEC. 115 amends the effective date from January 1, 2011, to July 1, 2012, for certain family members' qualification. SEC. 116 extends COBRA benefits for specific TAA-eligible individuals and PBGC recipients. ERISA, IRC, and PHSA amendments extend deadlines from December 31, 2010, to June 30, 2012, for PBGC recipients and TAA-eligible individuals. Section 2202(2)(A)(iv) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to change the deadline from December 31, 2010, to June 30, 2012. The amendments apply to coverage periods ending on or after December 31, 2010. SEC. 117 amends the Internal Revenue Code to change the effective date for coverage through voluntary employees' beneficiary associations. SEC. 118 amends the Code to change notice requirements. Subtitle C introduces modifications to the Trade Adjustment Assistance program, including a Community College and Career Training Grant Program. Section 278(a) of the Trade Act of 1974 is amended to include individuals eligible for unemployment compensation. Section 279 is amended to address administrative and related costs. The Secretary can retain up to 5% of funds for administrative purposes for the Community College and Career Training Grant program. Funds must supplement, not replace, other public funds for community college programs. Appropriated funds remain available for the fiscal year and the following year. TITLE II--OFFSETS

SEC. 201. Customs user fees amended to extend deadlines to March 31, 2020 and April 30, 2020.

SEC. 202. Increase in corporate estimated tax percentage by 4.5 points.

SEC. 203. Compliance with PAYGO requirements. SEC. 203. COMPLIANCE WITH PAYGO. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by reference to the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
